text: So recognizing and aligning individuals' unique adaptive beliefs or priors through cooperative communication is critical to establishing a therapeutic relationship and alliance.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Next bullet point, using active inference, we present an empirical, integrative account of the biobehavioral mechanisms that write therapeutic relationship.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Third bullet point, a significant mode of establishing cooperative alliances and potentially synchrony relationships is through extensive cues generated by repetitive coupling during dynamic touch.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And then established models speak to the unique role of affectionate touch in developing communication, interpersonal interactions, and a wide variety of therapeutic benefits for patients of all ages, both neurophysiologically and behaviorally.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: The purpose of this article is to argue for the importance of therapeutic touch in establishing a therapeutic alliance and, ultimately, synchrony between practitioner and patient.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: We briefly discuss a therapeutic alliance in prosocial and clinical interactions.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: We then discuss how cooperative communication and mental state alignment in intentional communication are accomplished using active inference.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: We argue that alignment through active inference facilitates synchrony and communication.

text: The ensuing account is extended to include the role of C-tactile afferents in realizing the beneficial effects of therapeutic synchrony.

text: We conclude by proposing a method for synchronizing the effects of touch using the concept of active inference.
